column4: Raising the federal minimum wage to $9 per hour would make it noticeably harder for low-skilled workers to find employment.
column6: Confidence in this topic (10 being the highest).
column7: The distortionary costs of raising the federal minimum wage to $9 per hour and indexing it to inflation are sufficiently small compared with the benefits to low-skilled workers who can find employment that this would be a desirable policy.
